contents.content1:
478/2= 239
Step 1:- Take last digit of number i.e. 8

Step 2:- Check whether it is even number or odd number i.e. 8/2 = 4 (even number)

Step 3:- If last digit is even number than number is divisible by 2 else not.

examples.example1:
Suppose you want to see '573' is divisible by 2 or not
Step 1:- Take last digit of number: 3

Step 2:- Check whether it is even number or odd number: 3/2 = Quotient 1, Remainder = 1 (Odd number)

Step 3:- As last digit is odd number than number is not divisible by 2.

examples.example2:
Suppose you want to see '99934654' is divisible by 2 or not
Step 1:- Take last digit of number: 4

Step 2:- Check whether it is even number or odd number: 4/2 = Quotient 0, Remainder = 0 (Even number)

Step 3:- As last digit is even number than number is divisible by 2.

contents.content1:
732/3= 244, (divisible by 3)
Step 1:- Add digits of originals number: 7+3+2 = 12

Step 2:- Check this number is divisible by 3 or not i.e. 12/3 = 4 (Divisible)

Note:- If number obtained from step 1 is very large number than we can continue the same method.

examples.example1:
Suppose you want to see '1022' is divisible by 3 or not
Step 1:- Add digits of originals number: 1+0+2+2 = 5

Step 2:- Check this number is divisible by 3 or not: 5/3 = Quotient = 1 Remainder = 2 (Not Divisible)

examples.example2:
Suppose you want to see '99924654' is divisible by 3 or not
Step 1:- Add digits of originals number: 9+9+9+9+2+4+6+5+4 = 57

Step 2:-Add digits of this number: 5+7=12

Step 3:-Check this number is divisible by 3 or not: 12/3 = 4 (Divisible)

contents.content1:
4784/4= 1196 (Divisible by 4)
Step 1:- Take last two digit of number: 84

Step 2:- Check whether it is divisible by 4 or not: 84/4 = 21 (Divisible)

Note:-

Step 2:- Check whether it is divisible by 4 or not: 84/4 = 21 (Divisible)

examples.example1:
Suppose you want to see '7842' is divisible by 4 or not
Step 1:- Take last two digit of number: 42

Step 2:- Check whether it is divisible by 4 or not: 42/4 = Quotient = 10, Remainder = 2 (Not Divisible by 4)

examples.example2:
Suppose you want to see '9876872' is divisible by 4 or not
Step 1:- Take last two digit of number: 72

Step 2:- Check whether it is divisible by 4 or not: 72/4 = 18 (Divisible)

contents.content1:
9825/5= 1965 (Divisible by 5)
Step 1:- If last digit of number is '0' or '5' than it is divisible by 5 else not.

examples.example1:
Suppose you want to see '57279' is divisible by 5 or not
Step 1:- As last digit of number is '9', so it is not divisible by 5

Step 2:- As last digit is odd number than number is not divisible by 2.

examples.example2:
Suppose you want to see '75640' is divisible by 5 or not
Step 1:- As last digit of number is '0', so it is divisible by 5

contents.content1:
738/2= 123 (Divisible by 6)
Step 1:- Check whether last digit of number is even number or not: 8/2 = 4 (even number)

Step 2:- Add digits of original number: 7+3+8 = 18

Step 3:- If this number is divisible by 3, than original number is divisible by 6 else not: 18/3 = 6 (Divisible)

Note:- If a number is divisible from both 2 and 3, it is divisible by 6

examples.example1:
Suppose you want to see '4800' is divisible by 6 or not
Step 1:- Check whether last digit of number is even number or not: 0/2 = 0 (even number)

Step 2:- Add digits of original number: 4+8+0+0 = 12

Step 3:- This number is divisible by 3, so original number is divisible by 6: 12/3 = 4 (Divisible)

examples.example2:
Suppose you want to see '98765643' is divisible by 6 or not
Step 1:- Check whether last digit of number is even number or not: 3/2 = Quotient 1, Remainder 1 (Odd number)

Step 2:- Thus number is not divisible by 6

contents.content1:
539/7= 77 (Divisible by 7)
Step 1:- Multiply last digit of number to '-2': 9X-2 = -18

Step 2:- Add this number to the remaining number: 53 + -18 = 35

Step 3:- If this number is divisible by 7 than original number is divisible by 7 else not: 35/7 = 5 (Divisible by 7)

Note: - If number is very large than repeat step 1 and step 2 for the number obtained from step 2.

examples.example1:
Suppose you want to see '7752' is divisible by 7 or not
Step 1:- Multiply last digit of number to '-2': 2X-2 = -4

Step 2:- Add this number to the remaining number: 775 + -4 = 771

Step 3:- As this number is large so by repeating step 1: 1X-2 = -2

Step 4:- Repeating step 2: 77+ -2 = 75

Step 5:- This number is not divisible by 7, so original number is not divisible by 7: 75/7 = Quotient 10, Remainder 5

examples.example2:
Suppose you want to see '8673' is divisible by 7 or not
Step 1:- Multiply last digit of number to '-2': 3X-2 = -6

Step 2:- Add this number to the remaining number: 867 + -6 = 861

Step 3:- As this number is large so by repeating step 1: 1X-2 = -2

Step 4:- Repeating step 2: 86+ -2 = 84

Step 5:- This number is divisible by 7, so original number is also divisible by 7: 84/7 = 12

contents.content1:
4384/8= 548 (Divisible by 8)
Step 1:- Take last three digits of number: 384

Step 2:- Check whether it is divisible by 8 or not: 384/8 = 48 (Divisible)

Note:- If last 3 digits are divisible by 8 than number is divisible by 8 else not.

examples.example1:
Suppose you want to see '7842' is divisible by 8 or not
Step 1:- Take last two digit of number: 842

Step 2:- Check whether it is divisible by 8 or not: 842/4 = Quotient = 105, Remainder = 2 (Not Divisible by 8)

examples.example2:
Suppose you want to see '636688' is divisible by 8 or not
Step 1:- Take last two digit of number: 688

Step 2:- Check whether it is divisible by 8 or not: 688/8 = 86 (Divisible)

contents.content1:
93519/9= 10391, (divisible by 9)
Step 1:- Add digits of originals number: 9+3+5+1+9 = 27

Step 2:- Check this number is divisible by 9 or not: 27/9 = 3 (Divisible)

Note:- If number obtained from step 1 is very large number than we can continue the same method.

examples.example1:
Suppose you want to see '72564' is divisible by 9 or not
Step 1:- Add digits of originals number: 7+2+5+6+4 = 24

Step 2:- Check this number is divisible by 9 or not: 24/9 = Quotient = 2 Remainder = 6 (Not Divisible)

examples.example2:
Suppose you want to see '9992465163' is divisible by 9 or not
Step 1:- Add digits of originals number: 9+9+9+9+2+4+6+5+1+6+3 = 63

Step 2:- Add digits of this number: 6+3=9

Step 3:- Check this number is divisible by 9 or not: 9/9 = 1 (Divisible)

contents.content1:
75460/11= 6860 (Divisible by 11)
Step 1:- Find the sum of digits in odd place: 7+4+0 = 11

Step 2:- Find sum of digits at even place: 5+6 = 11

Step 3:- Find difference between number obtained from step 1 and step 2: 11 - 11 = 0

Step 4:- If this number is '0' or multiple of 11 than original number is divisible by 11: (Divisible by 11)

examples.example1:
Suppose you want to see '208351' is divisible by 11 or not
Step 1:- Find the sum of digits in odd place: 2+8+5 = 15

Step 2:- Find sum of digits at even place: 0+3+1 = 4

Step 3:- Find difference between number obtained from step 1 and step 2: 15 - 4 = 11

Step 4:- As '11' is a multiple of 11, thus this number is divisible by 11

examples.example2:
Suppose you want to see '50984522' is divisible by 11 or not
Step 1:- Find the sum of digits in odd place: 5+9+4+2 = 20

Step 2:- Find sum of digits at even place: 0+8+5+2 = 15

Step 3:- Find difference between number obtained from step 1 and step 2: 20 - 15 = 5

Step 4:- As 5 is not multiple of 11, Thus number is not divisible by 11

contents.content1:
1144/13 = 88 (Divisible by 13)
Step 1:- Multiply last digit of number to '4': 4X4 = 16

Step 2:- Add this number to the remaining number: 114 + 16 = 130

Step 3:- If this number is divisible by 13 than original number is divisible by 13 else not: 130/13 = 10 (Divisible by 13)

Step 4:- If number is very large than repeat step 1 and step 2 for the number obtained from step 2.

examples.example1:
Suppose you want to see '58787' is divisible by 13 or not
Step 1:- Multiply last digit of number to '4': 7X4 = 28

Step 2:- Add this number to the remaining number: 5878 + 28 = 5906

Step 3:- As this number is large so by repeating step 1: 6X4 = 24

Step 4:- Repeating step 2: 590+ 24 = 614

Step 5:- Again repeating step 1 and step 2: 61+ 16 = 77

Step 6:- This number is not divisible by 13, so original number is not divisible by 13: 77/13 = Quotient 5, Remainder 12

examples.example2:
Suppose you want to see '5174' is divisible by 13 or not
Step 1:- Multiply last digit of number to '4': 4X4 = 16

Step 2:- Add this number to the remaining number: 517 + 16 = 533

Step 3:- As this number is large so by repeating step 1: 3X4 = 12

Step 4:- Repeating step 2: 53+ 12 = 65

Step 5:- This number is divisible by 13, so original number is also divisible by 13: 65/13 = 5

contents.content1:
1921/17 = 113 (Divisible by 17)
Step 1:- Multiply last digit of number to '-5': 1X-5 = -5

Step 2:- Add this number to the remaining number: 192 + -5 = 187

Step 3:- If this number is divisible by 17 than original number is divisible by 17 else not: 187/17 = 11 (Divisible by 17)

Note:- If number is very large than repeat step 1 and step 2 for the number obtained from step 2.

examples.example1:
Suppose you want to see '60554' is divisible by 17 or not
Step 1:- Multiply last digit of number to '-5': 4X-5 = -20

Step 2:- Add this number to the remaining number: 6055 + -20 = 6035

Step 3:- As this number is large so by repeating step 1: 5X-5 = -25

Step 4:- Repeating step 2: 603+ -25 = 578

Step 5:- Again repeating step 1 and step 2: 57+ 8X-5 = 57 + -40 = 17

Step 6:- This number is divisible by 17, so original number is also divisible by 17: 17/17 = 1

examples.example2:
Suppose you want to see '8806' is divisible by 17 or not
Step 1:- Multiply last digit of number to '-5': 6X-5 = -30

Step 2:- Add this number to the remaining number: 880 + -30 = 850

Step 3:- As this number is large so by repeating step 1: 0X-5 = 0

Step 4:- Repeating step 2: 85 + 0 = 85

Step 5:- This number is divisible by 17, so original number is also divisible by 17: 85/17 = 5

contents.content1:
1691/19 = 89 (Divisible by 19)
Step 1:- Multiply last digit of number to '2': 1X2 = 2

Step 2:- Add this number to the remaining number: 169 + 2 = 171

Step 3:- If this number is divisible by 19 than original number is divisible by 19 else not: 171/19 = 9 (Divisible by 19)

Step 4:- If number is very large than repeat step 1 and step 2 for the number obtained from step 2.

examples.example1:
Suppose you want to see '16169' is divisible by 19 or not
Step 1:- Multiply last digit of number to '2': 9X2 = 18

Step 2:- Add this number to the remaining number: 1616 + 18 = 1634

Step 3:- As this number is large so by repeating step 1: 4X2 = 8

Step 4:- Repeating step 2: 163 + 8 = 171

Step 5:- This number is divisible by 19, so original number is also divisible by 19: 171/19 = 9

examples.example2:
Suppose you want to see '9941' is divisible by 19 or not
Step 1:-Multiply last digit of number to '2': 1X2 = 2

Step 2:- Add this number to the remaining number: 994 + 2 = 996

Step 3:- As this number is large so by repeating step 1: 6X2 = 12

Step 4:- Repeating step 2: 99+ 12 = 111

Step 5:- This number is not divisible by 19, so original number is also not divisible by 19: 111/5 = Quotient 5, Remainder 16
